Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “Normally I just roll my eyes and walk away because I’m fighting a losing battle and I’m fully aware of that,”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: paralegal for the Republican county attorney
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a Democrat in Niobrara County, Wyoming

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “Maybe that is why I’m well-liked, because I keep my mouth shut 10 times more than I want to.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: paralegal for the Republican county attorney
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a Democrat in Niobrara County, Wyoming

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “You feel skeevy and dirty when you do it. But you do it anyway and you change it back as soon as you can, because you don’t want to start getting the Republican mailings,”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: paralegal for the Republican county attorney
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a Democrat in Niobrara County, Wyoming

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I won two elections here. Even though that’s nonpartisan, people still knew I had left-leaning values,”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: paralegal for the Republican county attorney
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a Democrat in Niobrara County, Wyoming

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “How far are they going to go to limit one’s ability to vote? If it really comes down to purifying the party, on a voting level all the way up to the elected officials, pretty soon there isn’t going to be anyone left who’s pure enough to be in the party,”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a former middle school English teacher who switched parties to vote in the GOP primary

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “The best way to participate in meaningful change is to try to sway the dominant party,”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a Niobrara County resident who supports many left-leaning goals but registers as a Republican

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “You know, we need to have a government that serves the people, all of them, not just Republicans and not just rural and not just urban and not just Democrats — and definitely not just the rich and the wealthy.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a Niobrara County resident who supports many left-leaning goals but registers as a Republican

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “Most people don’t want to dive into those type of discussions,”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: high school boys basketball team coach
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a Democrat who coached the Tigers to their best record in a decade

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “They respect you for what you do, how you work.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: high school boys basketball team coach
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a Democrat who coached the Tigers to their best record in a decade

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I am who I am, and I have the views that I have,”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: paralegal for the Republican county attorney
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a Democrat in Niobrara County, Wyoming

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “And I don’t care if it bothers people or not.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: paralegal for the Republican county attorney
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a Democrat in Niobrara County, Wyoming

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Party-switching had “undermined the sanctity of Wyoming’s primary process,”
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: a statement from Wyoming’s Republican secretary of state, Chuck Gray
